categories.title: Recent Developments in Web3 Marketing Automation, AI Agents, and Plugin Enhancements

content.text:
### Web3 Narrative Marketing Automation
- **Tech Stack**: Built using Langchain and ElizaOS.
- **Features**: Includes draft editing, scheduled replies, performance tracking, and a feedback loop for content improvement.
- **Next Steps**: Seeking early testers and community feedback to refine the tool.

### Token Prediction Plugin
- **Developer**: `dorianjanezic`
- **Implementation**: Uses a feedback loop (data → prediction → checks → evaluation → summary) to analyze token price movements.
- **Next Steps**: Plans to integrate reinforcement learning for improved accuracy.
- **Example Prediction**: Identified a 'pump, dump, and pump again' pattern in token price fluctuations.

### Tech-Support Bot on ElizaOS
- **Developer**: `chris.troutner`
- **Tech Stack**: JavaScript, Bitcoin, GitHub integration, and local AI models (Ollama).
- **Infrastructure**: Runs on a Linux desktop with an NVIDIA GeForce 3060 (12GB VRAM).
- **Clients**: Available on Telegram and Nostr (a censorship-resistant alternative to Twitter/Discord).
- **Next Steps**: Developing a Nostr plugin and separating the knowledge base from the bot code for modularity.

### AI Agents for Non-Technical Users
- **Developer**: `dtb0x`
- **Platform**: `aigent.sh`, powered by ElizaOS.
- **Next Steps**: Rolling out daily updates and seeking user feedback for improvements.

### Plugin Enhancements and Bug Fixes
- **Bug Fix for Character Plugins**: [dtb0x] fixed an issue with loading character plugins from remote URLs ([PR #3890](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/pull/3890)).
- **Mem0 AI SDK Provider**: [whysosaket] introduced Mem0 as a provider in the Vercel AI SDK, adding a memory layer for users ([PR #3927](https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/pull/3927)).
- **Onchain Token Price Plugin**: [0xmattsroka] developed a plugin for fetching token prices across 20+ chains, powered by DexPaprika ([PR #109](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/109)).
- **Twitter Plugin Update**: [tadeuchi] submitted a PR to fetch post data back to the client ([PR #108](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/108)).
- **Distributed Storage Plugin**: [fforbeck] contributed a plugin for distributed storage ([PR #111](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/111)).
- **Broken Plugin Link Issue**: [flaneurofmetaverses] reported a broken link in the plugin registry, and [odilitime] requested clarification.
- **AI-News Aggregation Setup**: [dankvr] configured AI-news to aggregate and summarize discussions from multiple channels.
The `auo client` was deprecated and integrated into the core in V2. Migration from V1 to V2 requires an auto-migration tool for plugins.
Cloudflare security changes blocked Twitter logins for agents running in Docker, particularly on GCP. A fix was implemented in PR #3793.
A bug in `jsdocs` caused duplicate memories. Issue #3897 was opened to track it, and a rebase was performed to resolve it.
Users requested the ability to run multiple agents on separate Twitter accounts. Namespacing in V2 allows for this setup.
Docker optimizations in V2 include smaller images, faster builds, and dynamic character file specification.
The `plugin-local-ai` plugin supports the Ollama API for local LLMs, allowing users to run AI models locally.
Users faced issues with `npx @elizaos/cli start`, and fixes were suggested. Additionally, `eliza-starter` will be phased out in favor of `npx elizaos start`.
A Git submodule issue on Windows was reported, and a workaround was provided by removing and re-adding the submodule.
New documentation was deployed at eliza.how, with improvements and fixes being discussed.
Some plugins, such as `plugin-llama`, were missing from the registry, causing installation failures. Efforts are underway to resolve this.

**Headless Chrome Issue:** The removal of the old Headless mode in Chrome caused issues with a browser plugin. While no direct solution was provided, switching to the new Headless mode or using `chrome-headless-shell` was suggested.
**REST API for Eliza Framework:** Users discussed available API endpoints for Eliza’s Direct Client. Documentation was shared to help with integration.

**Client Configuration via JSON vs. TypeScript:** There was confusion about whether `.json` character files or `.ts` files should be used for configuration. It was confirmed that `.json` should be used when possible, but `.ts` is required for advanced customization. Documentation updates are planned for Eliza V2.
**Eliza V2 Release Timeline:** The estimated release for Eliza V2 is within a week, with an alpha version expected next Monday.
**Custom Plugin Development:** Users inquired about creating and installing custom plugins, but no direct responses were recorded.
**Training a Model for Data Matching:** A user sought guidance on training a model to fetch relevant datasets based on descriptions, but no concrete solution was provided.
**Hosting ElizaOS with Next.js:** It was confirmed that ElizaOS can be hosted like a React project, provided the client runs on a long-running server.
**Handling Readme Files for Plugins:** A suggestion was made to centralize README files for better organization, especially for Solana-related plugins.
**Twitch Chatbot Loop Issue:** A chatbot was entering a response loop. The issue was resolved by ensuring actions/evaluators return JSON instead of plain text.
**RAG Knowledge Not Working:** A user reported that Eliza wasn’t using knowledge from an array of strings. The solution was to set `ragKnowledge=false`, as embeddings aren’t needed for string arrays.
**Crypto Data for Agent Tweets:** A user wanted to integrate real-time DeFi data into Eliza for generating tweets. A high-level approach was outlined, but no code examples were provided.

**Action Items:** Several technical tasks and documentation updates were identified, including fixing browser plugin compatibility, improving chatbot handling, updating documentation, and enhancing RAG Knowledge handling.
The `auo client` was deprecated and integrated into the core in v2. Migration from v1 to v2 requires an auto-migration tool for plugins.
Cloudflare security changes blocked Twitter logins for agents running in Docker on GCP. A fix was implemented in PR #3793.
A bug in `jsdocs` caused duplicate memories. Issue #3897 was opened to track it.
GitHub vulnerabilities were found in `meta-introspector/cloud-deployment-eliza`, with 62 vulnerabilities (19 critical).
Users wanted to run multiple agents on separate Twitter accounts. The solution in v2 is to use namespacing.
To improve tweet aesthetics, users should refine character files and avoid OpenAI.
The `eliza-starter` package will be phased out in v2, replaced by `npx elizaos start`.
Users faced authentication errors when running Eliza in Docker. The solution is to check environment variables with `doctor inspect`.
The `plugin-local-ai` plugin supports the Ollama API for local LLMs.
New documentation was deployed at `eliza.how`, and CLI issues with `npx @elizaos/cli start` were reported.
A bug fix for loading character plugins from remote URLs was submitted in PR #3890.
Mem0 was introduced as a provider in the Vercel AI SDK, adding a memory layer for users (PR #3927).
A plugin for fetching token prices across 20+ chains, powered by DexPaprika, was developed (PR #109).
A Twitter plugin update was submitted to fetch post data back to the client (PR #108).
A distributed storage plugin was contributed to the ElizaOS Plugin Registry (PR #111).
A broken link in the plugin registry for `plugin-bnv-me-id` was reported and is being investigated.
AI-news aggregation was set up to summarize discussions from multiple channels.
